headline: Sour Cream Cornbread
description: Quick and easy sour cream cornbread is extra moist with the addition of sour cream to the batter. Serve alongside chili, beans, sandwiches, and more.
name: Sour Cream Cornbread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, salt, and baking soda together in a large bowl. Add sour cream, butter, and eggs; stir until fully incorporated. Pour batter into the prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cornbread comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this cornbread for the first time tonight and it is the best cornbread I have ever had! Since there are only 2 of us, I quartered the recipe and made 4 muffins. I put a little water in the 2 empty muffin cups. The muffins were golden, tender and moist. This will be my go-to cornbread recipe from now on!

I made it exactly as written, with the exception of cutting it in half and using an 8x8 pan. I did use less sugar as it seemed like a lot of sugar. It was so tender and tasty. We loved it. We have tried many different cornbread recipes (some gluten free) and some with buttermilk, etc. I just happened to only have sour cream so needed something that would work with what I have on hand. I will definitely make this one again.

It was delicious but the cornmeal made it gritty. Good thing I had some (1/2c)stonground cornmeal, even though it said not to use but I ran out of reg cornmeal. I assuming they said not to use stone ground because it would make it too heavy or mushy . Does anyone know the reason? Was anyone else's gritty or textured due to reg cornmeal? I did add can of drained corn for texture & replaced some white sugar for brown for depth. The taste was wonderful & you didn't need added butter when eating. Of course sour cream makes it delicious & moist so much better than using milk.

This cornbread recipe is the best. The texture is light, moist and fluffy. Flavour is perfect, not too sweet. I did sub Truvia for sugar to reduce calories. I recommend covering the baking dish half way through the bake to avoid over-browning the top and to help with the rising.

I've followed celebrity chef's recipes and find them lacking. I've stopped trying other recipes after all you cannot improve perfection. Note: I 1/2 the recipe and make in 10inch cast iron skillet. I melt the butter in pan as it heats up.

The recipe is good. But I wasn't really looking for a recipe, I was just looking to see if there was anything out that said it was OK to put sourcream in cornbread, because I had already done it and was curious.

The first time I made this I followed the recipe and it was delicious! The second time I used 1/2 cup of sugar, Greek yogurt with honey instead of sour cream and added corn kernels. I didn't have any leftovers. The cornbread was moist either way and we prefer the Greek yogurt.
One of the best cornbread I've had ever!! I didn't have enough sour cream, so I added some milk. I also added some corn oil seeing that my melted butter was short too. Thank you!!!
This is delicious and moist. I reduce the sugar to 2/3 the original amount. A family favorite!
Family favorite!! My go to cornbread recipe. We like it best with white corn meal. If you add a touch more sour cream it is moister.

This is the best cornbread ever. I did add roughly half the sugar called for and it was plenty sweet. Make this, you will not be disappointed! Next time I'm going to add some shredded pepperjack cheese.
Very good and easy recipe. I halved the recipe and reduced the sugar to 1/3 cup. I spread some of the honey butter over the top when warm - delicious.

Excellent recipe! I didn't change anything, but halved the recipe, as I didn't want to make so much. It came out moist, not too sweet, and tasted divine. It was a perfect complement to my homemade pork and beans, and I can't wait to have some tomorrow morning, warmed with some jam. An all-around good cornbread.
I was short on sour cream so added olive oil mayo and Lighthouse blue cheese dressing
I can't believe how dry this came out with all that butter, eggs and sour cream. It was inedible. Maybe I overbaked it?
I loved this cornbread! I made it as per the recipe but did use only 3/4 cup sugar. I made muffins, and they were a huge hit!
This is now MY goto recipe. Not dry, not too sweet. Doesn't crumble apart.
I did this in cast iron, which took an extra 7-10 minutes. It turned out beautiful.

I have made this three times. The muffins were a bit dry, so I will reduce bake time. The 9x13 pan version is a very wet cornbread, regardless of length of time in oven. The flavor is excellent, but next time, I will adjust so that I don't end up with raw pudding in the center.

This recipe is sweeter than I normally like my cornbread, but thankfully it tasted fine alongside the chili I'd made since that was so savory. Next time, I would put maybe 3/4 or 1 cup of sugar for a full batch. I made a half-batch and baked it into muffins - the recipe says to bake muffins for about 25 minutes, but mine were done after about 20 minutes.
I made this in a cast iron skillet and it was amazing! Looked just like the picture at the beginning of the recipe. Make sure not to undercook. May take a little more time in the skillet.
Absolutely delicious. I’ve made this twice and my family loves it. This is the best cornbread recipe that I’ve ever had. Truly a keeper. Melt in your mouth tasty.
Great moist and sweet cornbread just like Grandma used to make!
thank you for delicious recipe. my husband loves corn bread and this passed with flying colors! Everyone has their own tweaks and this recipe works however you may want to add your own spin.
I made these as muffins. I baked for 16 minutes. Delicious! Will definitely be making these again.
I made this just as directed except I halved the recipe, and used a 10" iron fry pan. I turned out great, and I will make this again.
this corn bread should be illegal! I could not stop eating it. Made it as directed and second time with cheese and corn. Stupendous
I added some fresh diced jalapeños and sweet corn. It was wonderful!
It is the best cornbread I’ve ever made. I did cut back the sugar by 1/2 cup. This cornbread is moist like no other cornbread recipe I’ve ever made or eaten.

The best tasting corn muffin I have eaten and it was moist. The only corn meal I could find was coarse and next time I would either try to make it finer in my processor or search for a finer meal. We did not care for the honey butter but we are not big honey lovers. I like cream cheese on mine.

I made this almost as written, just cut back on the sugar, and added some whole kernel corn. Overall it’s a great basic recipe but I thought it really needed more flavor. Next time I’ll add some jalapeño or other hot pepper, and up the salt. Maybe black pepper too.

I’m not sure why everyone gets hung up about sweet vs not sweet cornbread. I say just enjoy this recipe because it’s fantastic! I am a big fan of sweet cornbread and have always made mine sweet. After using this recipe I will never use another recipe. Usually cornbread gets dry and stale by day two but this stays fresh and moist on day 5!
Good cornbread recipe, I agree, if you’re not big on sugar, reduce the amount, but this isn’t sickly sweet, just sweet, I prefer, hint of sweetness!
Absolutely one of the best recipe I tried. I sprinkled cinnamon on top. Serve warm with butter or extra cream.
made the muffins .. were fantastic
Great recipe! Light and crispy on outside- I did cut down the recipe because its just my husband and me at home now- these still turned out beautifully and went well with our Creamed Cabbage Soup
absolutely delicious!! even the picky eaters devoured this..and asked for more!

This was ok. A couple of issues are, storage and baking. The baking issue is cornmeal does not do the tooth pick test well. I thought it was baked and the center was still not baked well. So use your finger to get spring back. As far as storing after baking, this must be refrigerated. If you leave it out it will get moldy.
I used coconut flour instead because I like my cornbread on the sweet side. It came out wonderful and I will definitely make it again!
Too sweet for my taste.

I do not like the taste of too much butter so I reduced my butter by half. It turned out very well. The bread is fragrant and fluffy, the crust tastes a bit like cookie and you can still taste the buttery flavor. I understand cornbread is not the healthiest food...so reducing the butter makes me feel a little better :p

I made it twice - both times with GF flour. First time I overbaked it a bit so it was dry to me but everyone still seemed to like it. The second time I was more careful to not overbake it and it was more moist and delicious.
Excellent recipe! Made exactly as written and no changes needed.

I've only made this 3 times, but it tastes better at each sitting! This last time, I decided to add whole kernels of sweet corn to it. My family asked why with much concern as they continued to go back for more. This is always going to be my go to recipe for cornbread.

The. Best. Cornbread. 
I used brown sugar instead of white and next time might use half egg whites because it’s a little eggy for me with all 4 eggs but seriously amazing cornbread. My entire family was in love!
It came out okay, I would say a bit dry. Liked it - but not enough to make it anytime soon. Thanks for the recipe.
I only used a cup of sugar. I also sifted the dry ingredients.
Fabulous.......exceeded expectations. I used full fat plain yogurt instead of sour cream and decreased the sugar by half. This is now my go to recipe for cornbread. Thank you.
In half of the pan, I mixed chopped jalapenos from a jar. The recipe was excellent and the dog loved the splattered sour cream.

Would definitely make again, except I'd divide the sum ingredients by half; this makes a huge cornbread. This is an exceptionally good, Southern, sweet bread. It was scrumptious hot and fresh from the oven and warms nicely as leftovers.
THIS ONE ALSO IS A GOOD ONE. I DON'T BAKE MUCH BUT I WILL USE THIS ONE AT ANY TIME. IT WAS SO GOOD.

I planned on making this as recipe was written,but I was short on cornmeal by about one third cup. Since I had some grits I added one third cup of that. I don't care for sweet cornbread so I only used three quarter cup of sugar. I always check the recipe after I have it mixed. Low and behold,I used baking powder mistakenly,so I added 1 tsp baking soda. I tasted the batter and to me it was still a little sweet,so I sprinkled a bit more salt in. I was not sure how it would turn out,but it was scrumptious! I've been baking over 50 years,so I kind of know what to do when I screw up a recipe. Again,it was delicious.

This cornbread was perfection. Better than my friends recipe with bacon fryin’s.
I read reviews and used 3/4 c sugar.
Sweet but not sugary so you can still taste the sour cream and corn. This will be a go to going forward. Thank you!
Really liked this cornbread and have made it several times. My husband said this is a keeper.

I made 1/2 recipe since I am the cornbread eater. It is great, right now I have 2 pkgs ready for the freezer for that next corn bread urge or my next chili splurge. Oh yeah, i did cut back on the sugar a bit and still totally delicious. Great recipe!
I love this recipe! It's the only one I use anymore. I usually make it with chili and leftovers with butter are just as good. Sometimes I add a can of drained corn to the batter if I have it.
Absolutely the best recipe I have tried. Say no more. This is a keeper. Followed the recipe to a T! Perfect!

This recipe does not need any changes. I added corn but I think it would have been better without. I also made honey butter to go with it, but ended up not using it because the bread was so sweet and moist.
Was delicious, the family loved it.
I cut the recipe in half and baked in a cake pan. This bread is super moist and flavorful.
Since there is only two of us I halved the recipe, it is perfect and does not fall apart , my search for the ultimate cornbread is done. followed the recipe baked in a cast iron skillet,
What the other people said. The sour cream does something special. Half recipe is plenty for a regular sized pie pan or 12 muffins.
My family loved this! I'm not a cornbread fan, and I even liked it- but the people who like cornbread...they devoured it! I'm making another batch this morning (by request). Thank you!
Made four versions of muffins from this recipe: “as is”, with blueberries, with banana and with jalapeño & cheddar. All turned out fantastic; thanks for the great recipe!
The best corn bread hands down! This is my go to recipe forever!
It is Perfect recipe I try to find . I made it with non fat Greek Yogurt instead of sour cream. Taste and texture is great. Thank you for your cornbread recipe. Have a great day.
Delicious as is.
Very good will make again
All I can say is this choir bed is so exquisite I already made it six times already my family loves it .
Moist but not too cakey.
This is an amazing recipe. I will make this over and over again.

I didn't make any changes and I will definitely make this again and again! It is perfect. Just the right touch of sweetness and the texture is the best I've ever had. I have tried a lot of cornbread in my life but this is going to be MY cornbread from now on.
I did not make any changes. How can you improve on a 5 star recipe? I've been making it for years. It's my husband's favorite, and freezes well. because it makes a lot.
Perfect
Made it a simple written but made as muffins to take to a luncheon. Great reviews from all. I served it with honey butter and cheese! Yum!
Followed the recipe to the letter and it turned out great. Next time, will probably cut back on the sugar to maybe half.
We loved this cornbread. I followed the recipe, exactly. If you make this, don’t change a thing!
Excellent cornbread recipe - moist, tender and flavorful with a great crusty bottom and sides. I add chopped green chili (NOT canned) or jalapeños.

Texture, crumb and chew all good
Needs more corn flavor
With all the good things about this bread I’ll try adding Some ground frozen corn with juice to the next batch
I doubled the baking soda and salt. This reccipe is a little large for 1 tsp. each.
This is an excellent recipe, how ever I did change it. I added three jalapenos and a cup of cheese.
Wonderful recipe! My whole family loved it!

Out of all the recipes for cornbread I’ve made (and I’ve tried three), this one is by far the best. It has more in terms of ingredients and though others say to use a 9x13 pan, this one actually fills the pan well when baked. It is dense but airy. I reduced the sugar by a 1/3 and it was a vaguely sweet bread, which I liked. Throw a bit of butter on it and it is heaven!

It may sound odd but I made this exactly like the recipe calls for.
Was it perfect? near.
It came out of the oven at midnight and by 1 A.M. I wanted to cover it and go to bed. This may have been a bad idea as in the morning it had fallen somewhat and it ended up with a soggy layer throughout the middle portion. The edges were unaffected and the whole thing was eaten.
It had passed the toothpick test and I had baked it 32 minutes in a ceramic Corelle baking pan. The Corelle doesn't cool nearly as fast as metal and was warm to touch an hour out of the oven.
I'm open to suggestions...
I added a can of creamed corn. Moist and delicious!
Delicious and great texture. I cut the sugar to 1/4 cup, and it was still plenty sweet.
I made a half batch in my cast iron pan baked for 15 mins. I substituted coconut sugar and browned the butter first. Amazing!
No changes made. The best corn bread we have ever made
I was excited about this after reading the reviews. However, mine came out on the dry side. Rise flavor look and ease of this cornbread can’t be beat!! I think next time I will add some milk.
It’s the best.

I've made this twice and my review is based on the first time I made it. I followed the recipe exactly as written. It was easy to put together and baked up well. It was a little sweeter than I care for and not "corny" enough for my taste, but it was still very tasty. 

The second time I made it I increased the cornmeal to 2-1/2 cups and reduced the flour to 1-1/2 cups. I also reduced the sugar to 1 cup and wound up with cornbread that was more to my taste.
Halved the recipe using 1/4 cup sugar and 1/3 cup butter. Filled 12 muffin cups, baked 25 minutes. Served with black bean soup and the avocado salad from this site. Delicious!

Made this last night. Perfect! Great base recipe!! I added one can of whole kernel corn and 2 c cheese. I also baked in my cast iron skillet. I’ve got the large 12 in. I melted bacon fat in the pan and allowed the grease to get hot in the oven. When the oven reached 375, pulled the skillet out, pored the batter into the skillet, and 30 mins later, Voila! Served for our “Friendsmas” with spicy chili and it was a crowd favorite!!! Thanks for the recipe!
Everyone loved it. It was a little too sweet for me, so I may cut the sugar next time, but I had everyone at the party clamoring for the last piece.
Loved this easy recipe. I opted to make muffins and when they came out of the oven I drizzled a little more melted butter on top. Made them extra yummy!
Only change I made was Splenda for the sugar since my wife is diabetic. Excellent corn bread.
This cornbread was amazing!!! Three of us ate 1/2 the pan in one night!!
So moist and full of corn flavor!

A little worried, the batter tasted just like a sugar cookie. But the final product is good. Im going to make with a tad less flour, and more corn meal and only 3/4 cup of sugar next time. I bet that will make it better for us. Thanks!
